materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Holidays Prints (100 g/3.5 oz) - 1 ball of #47005 (Holly Jolly Prints)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H / 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx  5 (8) ins [12.5 (20.5) cm] long.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. Larger size shown in ( ). 
Note: 1 ball makes 4 small and 4 large Icicles.
Ch 19 (31) loosely. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 2 sc in each of next 1 (3) ch. 3 hdc in each of next 2 (4) ch. 4 dc in each of next 4 (6) ch. 5 tr in each ch to end of ch. Fasten off.

materials: Worsted Gauge Yarn (as supplied in kit)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] tall, excluding Hanging Loop.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Crochet a gauge swatch.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ornament is worked in continuous rnds, do not join at end of rnd.
• Move marker as work progresses in last st of each rnd. 
• Working with Stitch Markers.
• The workings of a crochet stitch.
BELL
With A, make magic loop. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 8 sc in loop. PM in last st. Pull magic loop tight.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. 24 sc.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 30 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 5 times. 25 sts.
8th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 5 times. 20 sc.
9th to 11th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
12th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 16 sts.
13th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Stuff Bell firmly.
14th rnd: (Sc2tog) 8 times.
15th rnd: (Sc2tog) 4 times. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Using long tail, weave through tops of sts in last rnd and pull tight to close. Fasten off.
Hanging Loop
Cut a strand of A 5" [12.5 cm] long. Fold strand in half and tie ends to form Hanging Loop. Pull Hanging Loop halfway through top of Bell, pull Hanging Loop through itself and tighten to secure.
Alternate: Using yarn needle, pass yarn through top of Bell and base of provided Keychain Clasp. Whipstitch and tie securely as close to top Bell as possible and weave in ends.
Bow
See diagram on page 3.
With B, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 4 sc.
7th to 11th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 4th to 8th rows, do not fasten off. Fold Bow in half so starting chain meets last row. Working through both thicknesses, work 4 sl st evenly across. Fasten off.
Bow Band
See diagram on page 3.
With B, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch to end of chain.
Wrap chain around center rows of Bow, join with sl st to 6th ch to form Bow Band. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Using long tail, sew bow to top of Bell, as shown.
Face
Split black yarn into 2 plies and embroider face on Bell using Straight stitch for mouth and French Knot for eyes, as shown.
STRAIGHT STITCH
FRENCH KNOT

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
measurements: Approx 4" [10 cm] tall, excluding hanging loop.
instructions:
Notes:
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry color not in use loosely up at WS of work.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc.
VERSION I
Body: With A, ch 8. 
Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join C with sl st in 1st sc.
2nd rnd: With C, ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same st as ch-3. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 3 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next sc. Rep from * to ** once more. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join D with sl st in any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to ** once more. Join A with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Turn.
4th rnd: (WS). With A, sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. Skip next (3 dc, ch-2, 3 dc) for armhole. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times. Skip last (3 dc, ch-2, 3 dc) for armhole. Join B with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Turn.
5th rnd: (RS). With B, sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 5 times. Join E with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Turn.
6th rnd: (WS). With E, as 5th rnd. Join C. Turn.
7th rnd: (RS). With C, as 5th rnd. Join A. Do not turn.
8th rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. (1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
Sleeves: 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st in ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in ch-1 sp of dividing rnd (same sp where 3 dc was worked). Ch 1. 3 dc in ch-1 sp before (3 dc, ch-2, 3 dc) of dividing rnd (same sp where 3 dc was worked). Ch 1. Join B with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Turn.
2nd rnd:  (WS). With B, sl st into ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same ch-1 sp. Ch 1 (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. Join E with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Turn.
3rd rnd: (RS). With E, as 2nd rnd. Join C. Turn.
4th rnd: (WS). With C, as 2nd rnd. Join A. Do not turn.
5th rnd: (WS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. (1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Join with sl st in 1st sc. Fasten off.
Rep on opposite side.
VERSION II
Body:  With B, ch 8. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st and 2nd rnds: With B, as 1st and 2nd rnds of Version I.
3rd rnd:  With D, as 3rd rnd of Version I. 
4th and 5th rnds: With A, 4th and 5th rnds of Version I.
6th rnd:  With D, as 5th rnd of Version I. Join B. 
7th rnd:  With B, as 5th rnd of Version I. 
8th rnd:  With B, as 8th rnd of Version I.
Sleeves: 1st and 2nd rnds:  With A as 1st and 2nd rnds of Version I. 
3rd rnd:  With D, as 2nd rnd of Version I. Join B.
4th rnd:  With B, as 2nd rnd of Version I. 
5th rnd:  With B, as 5th rnd of Version I.
VERSION III
Body:  With C, ch 8. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st and 2nd rnds:  With C, as 1st and 2nd rnds of Version I.
3rd rnd: With E, as 3rd rnd as of Version I.
4th and 5th rnds:  With A, as 4th and 5th rnds of Version I.
6th rnd:  With E, as 5th rnd of Version I. Join C. 
7th rnd:  With C, as 5th rnd of Version I. 
8th rnd:  With C, as 8th rnd for Version I.
Sleeves: 1st and 2nd rnds:  With A, as 1st and 2nd rnds of Version I. 
3rd rnd:  With E, as 2nd rnd of Version I. Join C.
4th rnd:  With C, as 2nd rnd of Version I..
5th rnd:  With C, as 5th rnd of Version I.
All Versions: Hanging Loop
With shade matching 1st rnd of Body, cut 7" [18 cm] length. 
Tie ends tog to form a loop. 
Insert hook in 1st rnd at center front of Sweater. Yoh and draw loop through halfway. Pass loop through itself to secure.

materials: Medium Weight (#4) yarn of your choice
Contrast A Red 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Contrast B White 1 ball or 4 yds/3.5 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] tall, excluding Hanging Loop.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Crochet a gauge swatch.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
STOCKING
With A, ch 9.
See diagrams on page 3.
1st rnd: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd.ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 1 sc in same sp as first sc. Join. 18 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in same sp as first sc. Join. 22 sc.
3rd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 20 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Sc3tog. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join. 16 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join. 14 sc
10th to 14th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
At end of 14th rnd, join with sl st to back loop of first st.
15th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Sc2tog. Join in both loops. 10 sc.
Stuff Stocking firmly.
16th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Using long tail, weave through tops of sts in last rnd and pull tight to close.
Cuff: Join B with sl st to any rem loop of 14th rnd of Stocking.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 14 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, loosely sl st in each sc around. Join and fasten off.
Hanging Loop
Cut a strand of B 5" [12.5 cm] long. Fold strand in half and tie ends to form Hanging Loop. Pull Hanging Loop halfway through top of Stocking Cuff, then pull Hanging Loop through itself and tighten to secure.
Alternate: With B and yarn needle, pass yarn through top of Stocking Cuff and base of provided Keychain Clasp. Whipstitch and tie securely as close to top of Stocking as possible and weave in ends.
Face
Split black yarn into 2 plies and embroider face onto front of Stocking near the toe, as shown.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Short length of ribbon for hanging loop.
measurements: Approx 5½" [14 cm] tall.
instructions:
Santa
With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join 
with sl st to first sc.12 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 
sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc.  
2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each 
of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 
sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep 
from * to last 3 sc.  2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in 
each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each 
of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
8th to 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of 
next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops 
on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of 
next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join A with 
sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
12th rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back 
loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 
13th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops,  
*1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from 
* around. Join  with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
14th to 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc
around. Join B with sl st to first sc.
17th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc
around. Join with sl st to first sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops
only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join MC with
sl st to first sc.
19th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in both
loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with
sl st to first sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of
next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around.
Join with sl st to first sc.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 
Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. 
Join with sl st to first sc.
24th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. 
Rep from * around. 12 sc.
25th and 26th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
around. Join B with sl st to first sc at end 
of 26th rnd.
27th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Stuff Santa lightly.
28th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 6 sc. 
29th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Draw 
yarn through rem sts. Pull tightly and 
fasten securely.
Hat trim: Join B with sl st to rem front 
loop of first sc of 18th rnd. *Ch 3. Sl st 
in rem front loop of next st. Rep from * 
around. Ch 3. Join with sl st in same sp as 
first sl st.  Fasten off.
Beard
With B, ch 5 and work 9 tr in 5th ch from 
hook.  Fasten off.
Finishing
Sew Beard to Santa at 13th rnd. Sew 
beads for eyes above Beard as shown in 
picture. Cut a length of craft wire 4" [10 
cm] long. Twist wire as shown in diagram 
to form Glasses. Insert ends of Glasses 
into Santa. Attach ribbon as shown in 
picture for hanging loop.

materials: Worsted Gauge Yarn (as supplied in kit)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] tall, excluding Hanging Loop.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Crochet a gauge swatch.
instructions:
Notes:
• Worked in continuous rnds, do not join at end of rnd.
• Move marker as work progresses to first st of each rnd.
• Working with Stitch Markers.
• The workings of a crochet stitch.
SNOWFLAKE
Snowflake Back
Make magic loop. See diagram on page 2.
*1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 6 sc in loop. PM on first st. Pull magic loop tight, do not join.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.* Sl st in next sc and fasten off. Fasten off.

CROCHET I SKILL LEVEL: EASY

CROCHET AMIGURUMI SNOWFLAKE ORNAMENT 2 of 2

SNOWFLAKE POINT
Snowflake Front
Work from * to * as given for Snowflake Back, do not fasten off.
Hold Snowflake Front and Back WS tog with sl st of Snowflake Back aligned with next st of Snowflake Front.
Snowflake Points
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Working in rounds.
First Point:
Working into sts on both Snowflake Front and Back as follows:
**1st rnd: 1 sc in each of next 3 sc of Snowflake Front. Turn work so Snowflake Back is facing, work 1 sc in each of next 3 sc aligned with 3 sts of Snowflake Front. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 6 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 10 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 12 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join.
Stuff Snowflake Point lightly.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join.
Fasten off, leaving long tail. Using long tail, weave through tops of sts in last rnd and pull tight to close.**
Second to Fifth Points: Join yarn with sl st to next unworked sc of Snowflake Front. Ch 1. Beg in same sp as sl st, work from ** to ** as given for First Point.
Rep Second Point 3 times more – 5 Snowflake Points made.
Stuff Snowflake lightly.
Sixth Point: Work as given for Second Point for Sixth Snowflake Point – 6 Snowflake Points total.
With yarn needle, whip stitch Snowflake Front and Back tog in sps between each Snowflake Point.
Weave in all ends.
Hanging Loop
Cut a strand of yarn 5" [12.5 cm] long. Fold strand in half and tie ends to form Hanging Loop. Pull Hanging Loop halfway through top of one Snowflake Point then pull Loop through itself and tighten to secure.
Alternate: With yarn needle, pass yarn through top of one Snowflake Point and base of provided Keychain Clasp. Whipstitch and tie securely as close to top of Snowflake Point as possible and weave in ends.
Face
Split black yarn into 2 plies and embroider face on Snowflake Front, as shown, using French Knots for eyes and Straight Stitch for mouth.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit™ Set includes 12 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 600 g/21 oz total), yardage (85 m/93 yds each; 1020 m/1116 yds total)
Contrast A Black 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast B Jade 1 ball or 19 yds/17 m
Contrast C Pumpkin 1 ball or 23 yds/21 m
Contrast D Spring Green 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Contrast E Saffron 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Size U.S. 7 [4.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 4" [10 cm] tall, excluding hanging loop.
instructions:
Notes:
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry color not in use loosely up at WS of work.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc.
VERSION 1
Body
With A, ch 8. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join C with sl st in 1st sc.
2nd rnd: With C, ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same st as ch-3. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 3 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next sc. Rep from * to ** once more. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join D with sl st in any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to ** once more. Join A with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Turn.
Divide for Body and Armholes
4th rnd: (WS) With A, sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. Skip next (3 dc, ch-2, 3 dc) for armhole. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times. Skip last (3 dc, ch-2, 3 dc) for armhole. Join B with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Turn. Six 3-dc groups for Body.

5th rnd: (RS) With B, sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 5 times. Join E with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Turn.
6th rnd: (WS) With E, as 5th rnd. Join C. 
7th rnd: (RS) With C, as 5th rnd. Join A. Do not turn.
8th rnd: (RS) With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. (1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.  
Arms
1st rnd: Join A with sl st in ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in ch-1 sp of dividing rnd (same sp where 3-dc worked). Ch 1. 3 dc in ch-1 sp before (3 dc, ch-2, 3dc) of dividing rnd (same sp where 3 dc worked). Ch 1. Join B with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Turn.
2nd rnd: With B, sl st into ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same ch-1 sp. Ch 1 (3 dc in next ch 1 sp. Ch 1) twice. Join E with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Turn.
3rd rnd: With E, as 2nd rnd. Join C.
4th rnd: With C, as 2nd rnd. Join A. Do not turn.
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. (1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Join with sl st in 1st sc. Fasten off.
Rep on other side.
VERSION 2
Body
With B, ch 8. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st and 2nd rnds:  With B, as 1st and 2nd rnds for Version I.
3rd rnd:  With D, as 3rd rnd for Version I. 
4th and 5th rnds: With A, 4th and 5th rnds as for Version I.
6th rnd: With D, as 5th rnd. Join B. 
7th rnd: With B, as 5th rnd. Do not turn.
8th rnd:  With B, as 8th rnd for Version I.
Arms
1st and 2nd rnds:  With A as 1st and 2nd rnds for Version I. 
3rd rnd: With D, as 2nd rnd. Join B.
4th rnd: With B, as 2nd rnd. Do not turn.
5th rnd:  With B, as 5th rnd for Version I.
VERSION 3
Body
With C, ch 8. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st and 2nd rnds:  With C, as 1st and 2nd rnds for Version I.
3rd rnd: With E, as 3rd rnd as for Version I.
4th and 5th rnds:  With A, as 4th and 5th rnds for Version I.
6th rnd: With E, as 5th rnd. Join C. 
7th rnd: With C, as 5th rnd. Do not turn.
8th rnd:  With C, as 8th rnd for Version I.
Arms
1st and 2nd rnds:  With A as 1st and 2nd rnds for Version I. 
3rd rnd: With E, as 2nd rnd. Join C.
4th rnd: With C, as 2nd rnd. Do not turn.
5th rnd:  With C, as 5th rnd for Version I.
All Versions: Hanging Loop
With shade to match 1st rnd of Body, cut 7" [18 cm] strand. Bring both ends tog and tie to form a loop. Insert hook in 1st rnd centered to front of Sweater. Yoh and draw loop through halfway. Pass loop through itself to secure.

materials: Medium Weight (#4) yarn of your choice
Contrast A White 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Contrast B Red 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] tall, excluding Hanging Loop.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Crochet a gauge swatch.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ornament is worked in continuous rnds, do not join at end of rnd.
• Move marker as work progresses in last st of each rnd.
• Ornament is worked with 2 colors simultaneously. Do not carry color at WS, pull long loop and drop loop on hook. Insert hook into loop of next color, pull working yarn to tighten and cont.
CANDY CANE
With A, make magic loop. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 6 sc in loop. PM on last st. Pull magic loop tight, do not join.
2nd rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Drop loop on hook, do not break A. Join B with sc in back loop of next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Drop loop on hook, do not break B.
3rd rnd: Working in back loops only, pick up A and work 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Drop loop on hook. Pick up B and work 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Drop loop on hook.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm].

Break A at end of last rnd. Do not break B.
Stuff Candy Cane lightly.
Note: To stuff, loosely roll polyfill into sausages and use back of crochet hook to push into place.
Last rnd: Pick up B. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Using long tail, weave through tops of sts in last rnd and pull tight to close.

Assembly
Fold top 1" [2.5 cm] of Candy Cane down to form cane shape. With rem long tail, sew Candy Cane to itself to hold cane shape.

Hanging Loop
Cut a strand of A 5" [12.5 cm] long. Fold strand in half and tie ends to form Hanging Loop. Pull Hanging Loop halfway through top of Candy Cane, then pull Hanging Loop through itself and tighten to secure.

Alternate: With A and yarn needle, pass yarn through top of Candy Cane and base of provided Keychain Clasp. Whipstitch and tie securely as close to top of Candy Cane as possible and weave in ends.

Face
Split black yarn into 2 plies and embroider face near bottom of Candy Cane, as shown.

materials: Medium Weight (#4) yarn of your choice
Contrast A Red 1 ball or 33 yds/30 m
Contrast B White 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn
abbreviations: Sc3tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 3 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] tall, excluding Hanging Loop.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Crochet a gauge swatch.
instructions:
Notes:
• Worked in continuous rnds, do not join at end of rnd.
• Move marker as work progresses to last st in each rnd.
HEART
With A, ch 2.
See diagrams on page 3.
1st rnd: (RS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM on last st.
2nd rnd: (3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in first sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. 14 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. 18 sc.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. 22 sc.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. 26 sc.
7th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc. 30 sc.
8th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. 34 sc.
9th to 12th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
13th rnd: (Ch 1. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) twice. 26 sc.
14th rnd: (Working over ch-1 of 13th rnd, sl st in first skipped st of 12th rnd. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) twice. 22 sc
15th rnd: (Sl st in same sp as next sl st on 14th rnd. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) twice. 18 sc.
16th rnd: (Sl st in 2nd skipped sc of 12th rnd. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. 14 sc.
17th rnd: (Sl st in same sp as next sl st on 16th rnd. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. Sl st in next sl st. 10 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for seaming.
Stuff Heart firmly.
With yarn needle and long tail, whipstitch top of Heart closed.
Hanging Loop
Cut a strand of A 5" [12.5 cm] long. Fold strand in half and tie ends to form Hanging Loop. Pull Hanging Loop halfway through top of Heart at whipstitch, then pull Hanging Loop through itself and tighten to secure.
Alternate: With A and yarn needle, pass yarn through top of Heart and base of provided Keychain Clasp. Whipstitch and tie securely as close to top of Heart as possible and weave in ends.
Face Applique
With B, ch 5.
1st rnd: (RS). (2 tr. 1 dc. 2 hdc. 1 dc. 2 hdc. 1 dc. 2 tr. Ch 4. Sl st) all in 5th ch from hook. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Face
Split black yarn into 2 plies and embroider face onto RS of Applique, as shown.
Using long tail, sew Face Applique to center front of Heart.

pattern_name: DRIVING HOME FOR CHRISTMAS CROCHET ORNAMENT
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] long.
instructions:
Notes: When changing colors, hold color not in use at WS of work. Join all rnds with sl st to first st. 
Car Body (make 2)
With A, ch 17.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 14 sc.
4th row: As 3rd row. 12 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn. 8 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Fasten off.

Edging: Holding WS tog, join B with sl st at any point around Car Body. Working through both thicknesses, proceed as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around Car Body. Join. Fasten off.

Window
With B, ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. 5 sc. Fasten off.
Sew Window to Car Body as shown in photo.
Using A, embroider line in middle of Window.

Wheels (make 2)
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Break B. Join with D. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: With D, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
Sew Wheels to Car Body as shown in photo.

Tree
With C, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 7 sc.
3rd and alt rows: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Working  in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 5 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. Working  in back loops only, 1 sc in next sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. Working  in back loops only, Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Sew Tree to top of Car Body as shown in photo.
Using a length of E, wrap and embroider yarn around Tree as shown in photo.

Car Lights and Door Details
Using B, embroider Car Lights with satin st as shown in photo. Using same length, embroider door details.

Hanging Loop
With A, ch 12.
Fasten off.
Sew Hanging Loop to Car Body as shown in photo.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
measurements: Approx 3½" [9 cm] tall, excluding hanging loop.
instructions:
Notes: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
TOP BUN 
Notes: Do not join at end of rnd. 
Work in continuous rnds.
Move marker as work progresses.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. PM at end of rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 24 sc.
5th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 30 sc.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 36 sc.
8th rnd: As 6th rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
BOTTOM BUN 
With A, ch 2.
Work 1st to 5th rnds as given for Top Bun.
Next rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 36 sc.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
BURGER PATTY (Front and Back make alike) 
With C, ch 2.
Work 1st to 6th rnds as given for Bottom Bun.
Next rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 42 sc.
Fasten off for Front. Do not fasten off for Back.
Joining rnd: Hold Front and Back with WS tog, working through both thicknesses, sl st in each st around, leaving opening for stuffing. Stuff Patty. Sl st to end of rnd. Fasten off.
Notes: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
LETTUCE 
With B, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first dc. 2 sc in each dc around. Join. 48 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Ch 2. Join. Fasten off.
TOMATO 
With E, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. Dcfp around first dc. *1 dc in next dc. Dcfp around same dc as last dc made. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next st. Dcfp around same st as last dc made. *1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Dcfp around same st as last dc made. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sts.
Fasten off.
CHEESE 
With D, ch 14.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 13 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 11 times more.
Fasten off at end of last row, leaving a long end.
FINISHING 
With A, sew edges of Bottom Bun to one side of Lettuce, stuffing lightly as you sew.
With A, sew Bottom Bun/Lettuce to one side of Patty, sewing through all thicknesses and pulling slightly to draw pieces tog.
With D, sew Cheese to top of Patty. Sew corners of the cheese, stretching points slightly down the sides of the Patty.
With A, sew Tomato to top of Cheese, sewing through all thicknesses and pulling slightly to draw pieces tog.
With A, sew edges of Top Bun to top of Tomato, stuffing lightly as you sew.
Face: With F, using back stitch, embroider smile as shown in picture. With F, using French knot, embroider eyes on front of Top Bun.
Back Stitch
French Knot
Thread gold ribbon through top of ornament. Tie ends tog with bow or overhand knot to form hanging loop.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (Solid: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 5½" [14 cm] tall.
instructions:
Notes: Head and body of snowman are worked in one piece. Do not join at end of rnds. Work in continuous rnds (spirals). PM for beg of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.

SNOWMAN (make 3)
Beg at top of head with A, ch 2.

Head
1st rnd: (RS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
Rnd 3: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th to 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
9th rnd: Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 12 sc.
10th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.

Body
11th rnd: 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next 2 sc. 18 sc.
12th rnd: 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 24 sc.

13th to 21st rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Stuff snowman and continue stuffing as work progresses.
22nd rnd: 1 sc in next sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 18 sts.
23rd rnd: (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 12 sts.
24th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Flatten last rnd and sew opening closed. Using photograph as a guide, use back stitch to create arms and legs, sewing all the way through body from front to back and then from back to front again and pulling fairly tightly.

HAT (make 3 – 1 each with C, D, and E)
Ch 6.

Ribbing
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. 5 sc. Turn.
Next 21 rows: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn at end of last row.

Top of Hat
23rd row: Ch 1. Working along side edge of ribbing, 1 sc in end of each row. Turn. 22 sc.
24th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 7 times. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 15 sts.
25th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
26th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 12 sts.
27th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
28th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Turn. 8 sts.
29th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. 4 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through st of last row and pull to gather st tog. Fold piece in half and sew edges tog for back seam. Roll up brim and sew hat to top of snowman’s head.

Top Tail
With hat color yarn, ch 7.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. 6 sl sts.
Fasten off. Use yarn ends to tie top tail to hat.

Pompom
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc. Do not join. Work in continuous rds (spirals). PM for beg of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through sts of last rnd and pull to gather sts tog. Sew pompom to end of top hat.

SCARF (make 3 – 1 each with C, D and E)
Ch 30.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain.
Fasten off. Tie scarf around snowman’s neck and tack in place.

FINISHING
Facial Features
Use photograph as a guide.
Eyes and Buttons: With F, embroider French Knot eyes and buttons.
Nose: With B, embroider a Bullion st for nose, wrapping yarn around needle 5 times.
Cheeks: With red crayon, color cheeks.

materials: Medium Weight (#4) yarn of your choice
Contrast A Green 1 ball or 30 yds/27 m
Contrast B Red 1 ball or 4 yds/3.5 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn
abbreviations: Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook – picot made.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] tall, excluding Hanging Loop and Bow.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Crochet a gauge swatch.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
WREATH
See diagrams on page 3.
With A, ch 12. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th to 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Making sure RS of Wreath is facing out, sew foundation ch and 16th rnd tog using long tail, stuffing Wreath firmly at same time.
Hanging Loop: Cut a strand of B 5" [12.5 cm] long. Fold strand in half and tie ends to form Hanging Loop. Pull Hanging Loop halfway through top of Wreath, then pull Hanging Loop through itself and tighten to secure.
Alternate: With B and yarn needle, pass yarn through top of Wreath and base of provided Keychain Clasp. Whipstitch and tie securely as close to top of Wreath as possible and weave in ends.
BOW
With B, ch 50. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. Loop into bow and wrap yarn around center to secure. Sew Bow to top front of Wreath centered in front of Hanging Loop.
LEAVES (make 2)
With A, ch 4.
1st rnd: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (1 hdc. Picot. 1 hdc) all in next ch. (1 hdc. Picot. 3 hdc. Picot. 1 hdc) all in next ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, (1 hdc. Picot. 1 hdc) all in next ch. (1 sc. Picot) in same sp as first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
With yarn needle and A, sew Leaves onto front of Wreath under Bow, with last Picot worked pointing down, as shown.
Face: Split black yarn into 2 plies and embroider face on bottom front of Wreath, centered under Bow, as shown.

materials: Caron® Little Crafties™ (20 g/.07 oz per shade x 20 shades)
Version 2: Classic Blue, Sky Blue, Bright Green
Size U.S G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and pull through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 4" [10 cm] diameter.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Version 1: Mustard as Color 1, Icy Teal as Color 2, Lemon as Color 3.
Version 2: Classic Blue as Color 1, Sky Blue as Color 2, Bright Green Color 3.
Version 3: Peony as Color 1, Magenta as Color 2, Evergreen as Color 3.
Front and Back
With Color 1, ch 3.
1st rnd: (RS). [1 dc. Ch 1. (Dc2tog. Ch 1) 5 times] all in 3rd ch from hook. Break Color 1. Join Color 2. 12 sts.
2nd rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. *1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Break Color 2. Join Color 3. 24 sc.
4th rnd: With Color 3, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Break Color 3. Join Color 2. 36 sc.
6th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc. Fasten off.
Edging: With Front and Back held WS tog, join Color 1 with sl st in back loop only of any st. Working through both thicknesses and back loops only (slipping ornament inside when 14 sts rem), 1 sc in next sc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Fasten off, leaving opening at top for hanging loop.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Crochet Thread (85 g/3 oz; 339 m/371 yds)
Size 1.75 mm (U.S. 4) steel crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit clear glass ornament 4" [10 cm] diameter.
instructions:
Motif (make 5).
Ch 5. Join with sl st top first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. (Ch 5. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 4 times. Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 7. 1 sc) around last hdc. [Ch 3. (1 sc. Ch 7. 1 sc) in next ch-5 sp] 4 times. Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc.
4th rnd: *(5 dc. Ch 1. 5 dc) in next ch-7 sp. Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around, ending with sl st to top of first dc. Fasten off.
Join 2 Motifs: Work 1st to 3rd rnds as given for First Motif.
4th rnd: [(5 dc. Ch 1. Sl st in corresponding ch-1 sp of adjoining Motif. 5 dc) in next ch-7 sp. Sl st in next ch-3 sp] twice. [(5 dc. Ch 1. 5 dc) in next ch-7 sp. Sl st in next ch-3 sp] 3 times, ending with sl st to top of first dc. Fasten off.
Join 5 Motifs in ring (see diagram).
Join 6th Motif: Work 1st to 3rd rnds as given for First Motif.
4th rnd: *(5 dc. Ch 1. Sl st in corresponding ch-1 sp of adjoining motif. 5 dc) in next ch-7 sp. Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around, ending with sl st to top of first dc. Fasten off.
Insert Clear glass ornament into joined 6 Motifs.
Top Motif (make 1).
Ch 15. Join with sl st top first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 15 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. (Ch 5. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc) 4 times. Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 7. 1 sc) around last hdc. [Ch 3. (1 sc. Ch 7. 1 sc) in next ch-5 sp] 4 times. Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc.
Remove hanging loop with cap from clear glass ornament. Push ch-15 ring over ball “neck”. Replace hanging loop with cap back in place and secure Top Motif around ball “neck”.
4th rnd: *(5 dc. Ch 1. Sl st in corresponding joining space of 2 adjoining motifs. 5 dc) in next ch-7 sp. Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around, ending with sl st to top of first dc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and pull through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 5” [12.5 cm] long.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc throughout. Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Head
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd:  10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 2. 2 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Break A. Join B. With B, 2 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 sc in next hdc) 4 times. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 dc in next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 2 hdc. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each of next 11 sc. Fasten off.
Hat
With C, ch 2.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 1 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 2 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 3 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 4 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Ch 10. Turn. 14 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 13 sc.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sts. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Sl st in each of last 3 sts. Turn.
10th row: Skip first sl st. Sl st in each of next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Dc2tog. Fasten off.
Hat Brim
With B, ch 12.
1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Sc2tog. 8 sc. Fasten off.
Sew Hat Brim to 6th row of Hat.
Pompom
With B, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc. Fasten off.
Sew Pompom to 1st row of Hat.
Sew Hat to Head as shown in photo.
Mustache (make 2)
With B, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sl st in each of last 2 ch. 4 sts. Fasten off.
Sew Mustache to Head as shown in photo.
Nose
With A, embroider nose between Mustache pieces using bullion st.

materials: Worsted Gauge Yarn (as supplied in kit)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] tall, excluding Hanging Loop.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Crochet a gauge swatch.
instructions:
Notes:
• Worked in continuous rnds, do not join at end of rnd.
• Move marker as work progresses to last st of each rnd.
• Working with Stitch Markers.
• The workings of a crochet stitch.

GINGERBREAD MAN
Head
With A, ch 2.
See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: (RS). 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM on last st.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: (3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) twice. 20 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
5th rnd: (Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) twice. 16 sts.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: (Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) twice. 12 sts.

Body: Cont for Body as follows:
1st rnd: (2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) twice. 16 sc.
2nd rnd: (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) twice. 20 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. 18 sc.

Legs
See diagram on page 3.
Cont for First Leg: 1st rnd: 1 sc in first sc. PM. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sl st in marked st, leaving rem sts unworked. 8 sc for First Leg. Move marker to last sc.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 7 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in next sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Using long tail, whip stitch bottom of Leg closed.
Fasten off.
Stuff Gingerbread Man lightly.
Cont for Second Leg: Join A with sl st through both thicknesses into first and last unworked sts of final Body rnd. Ch 1.
1st rnd: 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. PM on last st.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 7 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in next sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Using long tail, whip stitch bottom of Leg closed.

Arms (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM on last st.
2nd rnd: (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. 8 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th row: 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sl st in next st. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Leave rem sts unworked.
Flatten Arm so unworked sts meet. Using long tail, sew open end of Arm closed. Do not break yarn.
Sew Arms to either side of Gingerbread Body, with sts in last row at bottom so Arms point slightly upward, as shown.

Icing
With B and yarn needle, work chain stitch around perimeter of Gingerbread Man as shown, to create Icing outline.
Embroider buttons on Front of Gingerbread Man using French Knots and arm details using Straight Stitch, as shown.

Face
Split length of B into 2 plies and embroider face on front of Head using Straight Stitch for mouth and French Knot for eyes, as shown.

Hanging Loop
Cut a strand of B 5" [12.5 cm] long. Fold strand in half and tie ends to form Hanging Loop. Pull Hanging Loop halfway through top of Gingerbread Man, then pull Loop through itself and tighten to secure.
Alternate: With B and yarn needle, pass yarn through top of Gingerbread Man and base of provided Keychain Clasp. Whipstitch and tie securely as close to top of Gingerbread Man as possible and weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)

measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] diameter.
instructions:
First Side
**Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.** 40 sc. Fasten off.
Second Side
Work from ** to ** as given for First Side. Do not fasten off at end of last rnd.
Join sides: With WS tog, working through both thicknesses, work 1 sl st in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sl st. Do not fasten off.
Make hanging loop: Ch 20. Join with sl st in same sp as last sl st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Using B and diagram as reference, embroider snowflake with Lazy Daisy stitch on First Side.

materials: Medium Weight (#4) yarn of your choice
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge

abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] tall, excluding Hanging Loop.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Crochet a gauge swatch.
instructions:
Notes:
• Worked in continuous rnds, do not join at end of rnd.
• Move marker as work progresses to last st in each rnd.
STAR
Star Back
See diagrams on page 3.
**Make magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 5 sc in loop. PM on first st. Pull magic loop tight, do not join.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 10 sc
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. 15 sc.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. – 20 sc.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Sl st in next sc.** Fasten off. – 20 sc.

Star Front
Work from ** to ** as given for Star Back, do not fasten off.
Hold Star Front and Back WS tog with sl st of Star Back aligned with next st of Star Front.
Star Points
See diagrams on page 3.
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
First Point: Work into sts on both Star Front and Back as follows:
***1st rnd: 1 sc in each of next 4 sc on Star Front. Turn work so Star Back is facing, work 1 sc in each of next 4 sc aligned with 4 sts of Star Front. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 8 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) twice. Join. 6 sc
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) twice. Join. 4 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Using long tail, weave through tops of sts in last rnd and pull tightly to close.***
Second Point: Join yarn with sl st to next unworked sc of Star Front. Ch 1. Beg in same sp as sl st, work from *** to *** as given for First Point.
Rep Second Point twice more. 4 Star Points made.
Stuff Star lightly before completing Fifth Point.
Rep Second Point once more. 5 Star Points total.
With yarn needle, whipstitch Star Front and Back tog in sps between each Star Point.
Weave in all ends.
Hanging Loop
Cut a strand of yarn 5" [12.5 cm] long. Fold strand in half and tie ends to form Hanging Loop. Pull Hanging Loop halfway through top of one Star Point, then pull Hanging Loop through itself and tighten to secure.
Alternate: With yarn and yarn needle, pass yarn through top of one Star Point and base of provided Keychain Clasp. Whipstitch and tie securely as close to top of Star Point as possible and weave in ends.
Face
Split black yarn into 2 plies and embroider face onto Star Front, as shown.

materials: Bernat® Macramé™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 44 yds/40 m)
Contrast A Natural (66001) 1 ball or 1.5 yds/1.3 m
Contrast B Olive (66007) 1 ball or 1.5 yds/1.3 m
¾" [2 cm] wooden bead with a hole big enough to pass two strands of Bernat® Macrame™ through it
measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] long, excluding hanging loop.
instructions:
Note: Text in bold refers to knots illustrated with diagrams.
1. Cut 1 cord of A 10" [25.5 cm] long.
2. Fold cord in half and tie to top of wooden ring using Lark’s Head Knot.
3. Draw ends of cord through wooden bead from opposite sides for mustache. Trim.
4. Cut 5 cords of A 10" [25.5 cm] long.
5. Fold cords in half and tie to bottom of wooden ring using Lark’s Head Knot.
6. Cut length of ribbon for hanging loop and glue to back of top Lark’s Head Knot.
7. Make Hat by cutting ½" [1.5 cm] wide piece of toilet paper tube.
8. Cut 12 cords of B 10" [25.5 cm] long.
9. Fold cords in half and tie around toilet paper tube with Lark’s Head Knot.
10. Place Hat on wooden ring, ensuring hanging loop comes out of top of Hat.
11. Cut 1 cord of B 10" [25.5 cm] long and wrap twice around middle of Hat, tucking loose ends into work.
12. Un-ply loose ends of each cord to create fringe in ‘moustache’, ‘beard’, and top of Hat by twisting cord clockwise until plies loosen, separating plies from the cut end up to knot. Comb fringe and trim evenly into desired shape.

REINDEER
Head
With A, make magic loop.
See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in loop. PM in last st. Pull Magic Loop tight.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. 24 sc.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. 32 sc.

10th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 27 sc. Sc2tog. 28 sc.

13th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 12 sc.
Stuff Head firmly.

Ears (make 2)
With A, and leaving a long tail, ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.

Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
With B, and leaving a long tail, ch 6. Sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 6 sc.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join. 7 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Join. 4 sc.
7th row: Ch 4. 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Sl st in next sc. Leave rem sts unworked. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Using long tail, weave through tops of sts in last rnd and pull tight to close.
Stuff Antlers lightly.
Using long tails, sew 1 Antler to either side of Head, behind Ears, as shown.

Nose
With C, and leaving a long tail, ch 2.

Using long tail, sew Nose to front of Head, centered below marker, over 5th to 7th rnds of Head.

Hanging Loop
Cut a strand of A 5" [12.5 cm] long. Fold strand in half and tie ends to form Hanging Loop. Pull Hanging Loop halfway through top of Reindeer Head, then pull Hanging Loop through itself and tighten to secure.

Split black yarn into 2 plies and embroider face onto Reindeer, as shown.

instructions:
Notes: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
MUSHROOM
Stem
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS).10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd to 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 20 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sc.
Fasten off. Stuff Stem.
Cap
With A, ch 2.

7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.

FRENCH KNOT

materials: Polyester fiberfill, 18" [45.5 cm] thin gold ribbon (for hanger), stitch marker, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, B, and C
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Ornament measures about 4¼" [11 cm] long.
gauge: 20 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 20 rows/rounds = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HOT DOG
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook—5 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—10 sc.
Rounds 3–19: Sc in each sc around, adding stuffing as you go.
Round 20: [Sc2tog] 5 times—5 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Finish stuffing Hot Dog. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening at end of Hot Dog.
MUSTARD
With B, ch 30.
Fasten off, leaving a very long tail. With yarn tail sew Mustard in a squiggle along one side of Hot Dog.
BUN (make 2)
With C, ch 2.
Top
Row 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in each sc across—10 sc.
Rows 3–18: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 19: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] 5 times—5 sc.
Row 20: [Insert hook in next sc and draw up a loop] 5 times (6 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through all loops on hook. Pull tightly.
Sides and Underside
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 42 sc evenly spaced all the way around outer edge of top of bun. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Working in back loops only, [sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 3: Working in both loops, [sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff piece very lightly. Sew lengthwise seam. Sew one long edge of the two pieces of Bun together, sewing through the unused loops of Round 1.
FINISHING
Place Hot Dog into Bun with Mustard facing outwards. With C, sew Bun to Hot Dog, trying not to indent Buns.
Fold gold ribbon in half. Insert crochet hook around a few stitches at top of ornament, place ribbon fold on hook and draw through to form a loop. Thread ends of ribbon through loop and pull to tighten. Tie ends together with bow or overhand knot to form hanging loop.
Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)

Sizes U.S. D/4 (3.5 mm) and U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.

measurements: Approx 3½" x 5" [9 x 12.5 cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Roof 
With A and larger hook, ch 13. 
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc. Place marker on last st.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 4 times more. 2 sts rem.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Roof edging: 1st rnd: (RS). With larger hook, join B with sl st in marked st. Work 12 sl st evenly across shaped side of rows (lower edge of Roof). Sl st up straight side to Point. Ch 14 for hanging loop and sl st back into same sp as last sl st. Sl st down foundation ch. Join with sl st to first sl st.
Change to smaller hook.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Skip next sl st. *5 hdc in next sl st. Skip next sl st. Sl st in next sl st. Skip next sl st. Rep from * once more. 5 hdc in back loop of next sl st. Skip next sl st. Sl st in back loop of next sl st. Fasten off.

Running Stitch
French Knots
Roof Embroidery: With B, work running st embroidery across lower edges of 2nd, 4th, 6th, 8th and 10th rows. With C, D, E and F work French knots evenly spaced as shown between running st embroidery.
House
With A and larger hook, ch 13. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more (8 rows total). Fasten off.
House edging: With RS facing and larger hook, join B with sl st in top left corner. Sl st evenly down side, across foundation row and up opposite side to corner. Fasten off. Leave top edge unworked.
Heart
With C and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
First Hump: Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sc. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Second Hump: Next row: (WS). Join C with sl st to next unworked sc. Ch 1. Sc2tog over same st as last sl st and next st. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 2 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Sew Heart in position as shown. Sew Roof to House.
